alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 3:45PM MST until August 27 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 344 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated only light rain continues over the area at this time. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier and will continue to cause flooding along Black Canyon Creek and the Agua Fria River. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bumble Bee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 248 and 256. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek, Agua Fria River, Badger Spring Wash, Black Canyon, Tank Creek, Government Spring Wash, Sycamore Creek, Turkey Creek, North Fork Rock Creek, Castle Creek, Poland Creek and Larry Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
